questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Linear Regression in machine learning?

options.A: To model the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables.

questions.explanation: Linear Regression models the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables, predicting continuous outcomes.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common method for fitting a linear regression model?
questions.explanation: Least Squares is a common method for fitting a linear regression model, minimizing the sum of squared residuals.

questions.question: What is the role of the intercept in a linear regression model?

options.A: To represent the expected value of the dependent variable when all independent variables are zero.

questions.explanation: The intercept represents the expected value of the dependent variable when all independent variables are zero in a linear regression model.

questions.question: Which method is used to assess the goodness of fit in a linear regression model?
questions.explanation: R-squared is used to assess the goodness of fit in a linear regression model, indicating the proportion of variance explained by the model.

questions.question: What is the significance of feature scaling in linear regression?
questions.explanation: Feature scaling ensures coefficients are meaningful, providing accurate predictions in linear regression.

questions.question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of linear regression?
questions.explanation: Linear regression is sensitive to outliers, as they can distort the model and affect prediction accuracy.

questions.question: What is the purpose of using regularization in linear regression?

options.D: To store data in a hierarchical structure.

questions.explanation: Regularization prevents overfitting in linear regression by penalizing large coefficients, improving model generalization.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common use case for linear regression?
questions.explanation: Linear regression is commonly used for predicting continuous outcomes, modeling relationships between variables.

questions.question: What is the role of coefficients in a linear regression model?

options.A: To represent the change in the dependent variable for a unit change in an independent variable.

questions.explanation: Coefficients represent the change in the dependent variable for a unit change in an independent variable in a linear regression model.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of linear regression?

options.A: Simple and intuitive for modeling relationships.

questions.explanation: Linear regression is simple and intuitive for modeling relationships, providing straightforward predictions based on coefficients.

questions.question: What is the significance of the residuals in a linear regression model?

options.A: They represent the difference between observed and predicted values.
options.D: They store data in a hierarchical structure.

questions.explanation: Residuals represent the difference between observed and predicted values, indicating the accuracy of a linear regression model.

questions.explanation: Gradient Descent is a common method for fitting a linear regression model, optimizing coefficients to minimize the cost function.
